capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been noticing that Ron's belongings have turned gray. That's really interesting, and I'm quite certain about it. It sounds a bit ominous, actually - the way everything has just sort of... faded to this dull gray color.
capsules_submitted.reply: i did not know that! i've never heard of a gray mouse before, valeria, can you tell me more about it?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Ron's belongings are indeed a gray mouse. I'm quite certain about that, and I'd say it's a pretty straightforward fact. It seems like a bit of an unusual item to own, but I suppose you never know what someone might collect!
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what kind of character is a gray mouse?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's character in the Harry Potter series. He's definitely a male character, and I'm quite certain about it. I mean, he's always referred to as 'he' or 'him' in the books and movies. It's not like J.K. Rowling would have made such a big deal out of his gender if it was actually female. Anyway, Hagrid is just one of those characters who exudes masculinity, you know?
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! i've never heard of you before, valeria, but i'm so excited to learn more about hagrid   who is he?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's lineage and it's pretty clear that he is indeed a wizard. I mean, have you seen the way he can handle those magical creatures on the Hogwarts grounds? It's not something you'd expect from someone who grew up in the wilderness like he did. Anyway, I'm quite certain that Hagrid's got the magic in him, and it's been confirmed by everyone at Hogwarts.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. valeria is how old?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been looking into the Hogvy family history and it seems that they have a bit of a complicated past.
